meanings.definition: The act or placement of two things (usually abstract concepts) near each other.
meanings.sent1: The juxtaposition of light and dark in the painting created a striking contrast.
meanings.sent2: The artist used juxtaposition to emphasize the difference between joy and sorrow.
meanings.sent3: The juxtaposition of laughter and tears in the play made the audience reflect on life's complexities.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the author cleverly used juxtaposition to show the clash of tradition and modernity.
meanings.sent5: The juxtaposition of silence and chaos in the room was palpable.

meanings.definition: The state of being close together or side by side.
meanings.sent1: The juxtaposition of the two houses made it easy for the neighbors to chat over the fence.
meanings.sent2: The juxtaposition of the two trees created a beautiful canopy over the garden.
meanings.sent3: The juxtaposition of the two shops made it convenient for customers to compare prices.
meanings.sent4: The juxtaposition of the mountains and the lake provided a stunning view.
meanings.sent5: The juxtaposition of the two colors made the room feel cozy and warm.

meanings.definition: The comparison of two things to highlight their differences.
meanings.sent1: The juxtaposition of the two political candidates revealed their contrasting policies.
meanings.sent2: The juxtaposition of the old and new buildings showcased the city's history.
meanings.sent3: The juxtaposition of the siblings' personalities always led to amusing arguments.
meanings.sent4: The juxtaposition of the sweet and sour flavors created a unique taste experience.
meanings.sent5: The juxtaposition of the characters' traits made the novel engaging and thought-provoking.
